MobiKwik IPO: Know Latest GMP, Allotment, and Listing Dates - News18
summary:
MobiKwik IPO: Know Latest GMP, Allotment, and Listing Dates

Last Updated: December 15, 2024, 16:35 IST

The much-anticipated initial public offering (IPO) of One MobiKwik Systems Ltd has concluded with impressive subscription numbers. With an allotment finalisation date of Monday, December 16, and the listing scheduled for Wednesday, December 18, here’s all you need to know.

  • MobiKwik's unlisted shares are trading at Rs 444 per share, which is Rs 165 or 59.14% higher than the upper price band of Rs 279.
  • The IPO was open for bidding from December 11 to December 13 and received a 125.69 times subscription.
  • The retail investor category subscribed 141.78 times, while non-institutional investors subscribed 114.7 times.
  • The Qualified Institutional Buyers (QIB) category had a subscription rate of 125.82 times.
  • The IPO allotment process will be finalised on December 16, with shares debuting on December 18.
  • The issue size consists entirely of fresh equity shares worth Rs 572 crore.
The MobiKwik IPO has garnered significant attention from market participants, signaling a strong debut.

Stay tuned for the listing on December 18 as MobiKwik makes its mark in the public market space.
newTitle: MobiKwik IPO: Know Latest GMP, Allotment, and Listing Dates

'When You Get 100 MPs, You Celebrate...' Omar Abdullah Slams Congress Over EVM Charge - News18
summary:
When You Get 100 MPs, You Celebrate... Omar Abdullah Slams Congress Over EVM Charge

Date: December 15, 2024 Source: News18

Omar Abdullah has criticized the Congress party for questioning the reliability of Electronic Voting Machines (EVMs) after its electoral losses, arguing that parties should not blame the voting mechanism when election results are unfavorable.

  • Abdullah rebuffed Congress’s doubts about EVMs, emphasizing they can't question results only after losses.
  • He highlighted the need for consistency regarding trust in electoral mechanisms.
  • The Congress has called for a return to paper ballots following poor performance in recent state elections.
  • Abdullah drew on personal experience, stating he has faced defeat without blaming election systems.
“When you get a hundred plus members of Parliament using the same EVMs, and you celebrate that as sort of a victory for your party, you can’t then a few months later turn around and say… we don’t like these EVMs because now the election results aren’t going the way we would like them to.”

In conclusion, Abdullah’s remarks reinforce the stance that political parties must own their electoral outcomes without shifting blame to the voting systems.
newTitle: Omar Abdullah Critiques Congress on EVM Trust Issues

title: Mumbai vs Madhya Pradesh LIVE Cricket Score, SMAT 2024 Final: Shedge wins it for MUM as they claim their second SMAT title - The Indian Express
summary:
Mumbai vs Madhya Pradesh Highlights, SMAT 2024 Final: Shedge wins it for MUM as they claim second title

Date: December 14, 2024 Source: Indian Express

Mumbai's star-studded batting lineup successfully chased down a target of 175 runs set by Madhya Pradesh, winning the SMAT 2024 final.

  • Rajat Patidar scored an unbeaten 81 runs for Madhya Pradesh, helping them post a competitive total.
  • Mumbai, opting to field first, restricted MP to 175 runs in 20 overs.
  • Suryansh Shedge played a pivotal role by scoring a quick 36 runs off just 15 balls, leading Mumbai to victory in 18 overs.
  • Suryakumar Yadav contributed 48 runs, maintaining control over the innings.
  • This match marked Mumbai's second title in the tournament’s history.
“Despite batting at No 3 for RCB in the past, Rajat Patidar has been batting at No 5 for Madhya Pradesh.”

This thrilling final showcased Mumbai’s dominance in the Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy, further solidifying their status in Indian cricket.
newTitle: Mumbai Claims Second Title at SMAT 2024 Final Against Madhya Pradesh

title: 5 Majestic Pictures Of Space Captured By NASA - Times Now
summary:
5 Majestic Pictures Of Space Captured By NASA

Publication Date: Dec 15, 2024 | Source: Times Now Digital

This article showcases five stunning images of space captured by NASA’s advanced telescopes, highlighting various celestial phenomena.

  • NGC 3603: A brilliant cluster of young stars resembling a fireworks display.
  • Eta Carinae: A massive star on the verge of a supernova explosion.
  • Helix Nebula: A breathtaking view combining detailed and expansive perspectives.
  • Starburst Galaxy NGC 1569: An extraordinary starburst galaxy producing stars at an accelerated rate.
  • Carina Nebula: A view revealing hidden stellar nurseries and vibrant regions of star formation.
“Together, they create a seamless and breathtaking view of the Helix Nebula.”

This collection reveals the beauty and complexity of the universe, demonstrating NASA's capabilities in astrophotography.

title: Maharashtra cabinet expansion: Ajit Pawar's message to NCP legislators not getting ministerial berths - Hindustan Times
summary:
Ajit Pawar Addresses NCP Legislators on Ministerial Berths Following Maharashtra Cabinet Expansion

Date: Dec 15, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

Maharashtra deputy chief minister Ajit Pawar assured legislators without ministerial positions that they will have opportunities during this government's tenure, following the cabinet expansion where 39 ministers were sworn in, increasing the cabinet's size to 42.

  • 39 ministers were appointed in the latest cabinet expansion in Nagpur.
  • BJP received 19 ministerial positions, Shiv Sena 11, and NCP 9.
  • Ajit Pawar indicated that more opportunities for becoming ministers will be available over the next two-and-a-half years.
  • Despite many deserving candidates, ministerial berths are limited.
  • This cabinet expansion follows the Mahayuti alliance's significant victory in the November 20 polls, securing 230 out of 288 seats.
“Everybody wants to become a minister and deserves an opportunity, but the ministerial berths are limited,” said Ajit Pawar.

In conclusion, the cabinet expansion reflects the government's efforts to make room for more representation while addressing the aspirations of their legislators in Maharashtra.
newTitle: Ajit Pawar Addresses NCP Legislators on Ministerial Berths Following Maharashtra Cabinet Expansion

title: Abhishek Manu Singhvi: ‘One Nation, One Election will face serious Constitutional challenges … it violates the Basic Structure’ - The Indian Express
summary:
Abhishek Manu Singhvi: ‘One Nation, One Election will face serious Constitutional challenges … it violates the Basic Structure’

Publication Date: [Insert Date Here] | Source: The Indian Express

The Centre is planning to introduce Bills for 'One Nation, One Election' in Parliament amid opposition concerns. Senior Congress leader Abhishek Manu Singhvi expresses legal and democratic objections to the proposed simultaneous elections.

  • Singhvi argues that the plan undermines the democratic mandate and could lead to constitutional challenges.
  • He describes the concept as appealing but fundamentally flawed due to its imposition on the will of the people.
  • Reports suggest potential legal ramifications that could violate the Basic Structure of the Indian Constitution.
  • The Congress and many regional parties oppose the proposal, emphasizing the need for maintaining federalism.
  • Concerns are raised regarding the practicality of synchronizing elections and the alleged financial benefits claimed by the government.
“Democracy is a festival of diversity, uncertainty, spontaneous will.”

In conclusion, Singhvi believes that while the initiative aims for uniformity, it risks undermining the essence of democracy in India.
newTitle: Abhishek Manu Singhvi Critiques 'One Nation, One Election' Proposal

Morne Morkel reveals one area where Indian bowlers need to get better at - The Times of India
summary:
Morne Morkel reveals one area where Indian bowlers need to get better at

Date: NEW DELHI Source: Times of India

Morne Morkel, India’s bowling coach, emphasized the need for improvement among Indian bowlers, particularly during the overs 50 to 80 against Australian batter Travis Head.

  • Morkel noted that the Indian bowlers struggled to execute their strategies effectively.
  • He highlighted the impact of the partnership between Travis Head and Steve Smith, which scored 171 runs in 31 overs.
  • Morkel indicated the need to improve execution during crucial phases of the match with a softer ball.
  • He defended the performance of other bowlers like Mohammed Siraj and Akash Deep, commending their efforts despite challenges.
  • Morkel backed Ravindra Jadeja, emphasizing his status as a world-class player despite a tough outing.
“First of all, we can say he's (Head) in pretty good form... but I think for us with the ball... that's one area I think we need to get better at.” - Morne Morkel

The Indian bowling team is looking to enhance their game strategy to perform better in upcoming sessions, aiming to contain the scoring rate efficiently.
newTitle: Morne Morkel highlights improvement areas for Indian bowlers

What is a 6-minute walking test (know what it can predict)? - The Times of India
summary:
What is a 6-minute walking test (know what it can predict)?

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Not specified

The 6-minute walking test is a simple and non-invasive measure of functional capacity focusing on endurance and aerobic capacity. This test evaluates how far a person can walk on a flat surface within six minutes, providing valuable insights into cardiovascular and pulmonary health, as well as overall physical fitness.

  • The test allows patients to walk as far as possible within six minutes on a pre-measured path.
  • Distance walked is measured and compared to normal values based on demographic factors.
  • The 6-minute walking test helps evaluate patients with cardiovascular diseases by predicting outcomes like hospitalization risks.
  • It assesses lung function in patients with chronic respiratory conditions.
  • The test is utilized for measuring overall physical fitness in older adults and individuals recovering from illness.
  • It can help predict survival and quality of life in patients with chronic diseases.
  • Before major surgeries, the test assesses a patient's readiness for the procedure.
The distance walked during the test is compared to normal values, which vary based on demographic factors like age and gender.

In conclusion, the 6-minute walking test not only measures walking distance but also serves as a critical predictive tool for various health outcomes, making it a vital component of patient assessment and treatment planning.
newTitle: Understanding the 6-Minute Walking Test and Its Predictive Value
